column2:
Node mission
Community Nodes bring together people interested in open innovation and open data, delivering small-scale, local and free events. They encourage local collaboration, and promote networking through ODI individual membership.
column4: Reach individuals people through free events
column6: Run lunchtime lectures and/or screening & discussion sessions of other ODI lunchtime lectures
column7: Sell organisational membership (SME or corporate) locally. Any sales to be coordinated through ODI HQ by alerting members@theodi.org

column2:
Deliverables
Host events that convene 300 people per annum. 
A continuous high score on delivery.
column4:
Host free events annually (one per quarter). These can be:
- open, public meet-ups
- closed focused group meet-ups
- hack events
column7: Run any paid-for events or workshops without prior aggrement/collaboration with HQ

column2:
Fees
£200/year + 10% on all sponsor/other income generated by the Node to ODI HQ
There is no minimum income requirement
This removes the 50:50 rev share from previously
column4: Node to pay upfront for individual members (at £1 minimum) as part of annual node fee. Node to then allocate these to local supporters throughout the year.
column7: Brand anything as ODI or ODIHQ. Do use ODI Node – [yourNodeName]

column4: Maintain your individual node website to a high standard, and to ODI editorial, communications and brand guidelines.
column6: Collaborate with HQ to host local events (where suitable for both parties)
Promote and use ODI materials, standards, tools and techniques
Present at external events using branded template powerpoint/sheets provided or mutually agreed.

column4: Engage with the Node network online (i.e scrums, working groups, etc)
column5:
Weekly = join Node standup (slack)
Monthly reporting drop-in
Quarterly retrospectives/focus meetings
Ongoing = join Node channel slack
column6: Work with the ODI Culture Programme to align on brand and delivery

(optional) 
Join in-person Node events at HQ if you wish to. 
Unless otherwise agreed in advance, ODIHQ will not cover travel or accommodation costs
